core_principles: Density over Whitespace: Data density is a feature, not a bug.
Function is Beauty: The aesthetic comes from the precision of the data.
High Contrast: Critical alerts must pop against the dark background.
Role-Based Context: Show only what is needed for the specific role.

usage_rules.headings: Use 'Chivo' for all page titles and section headers. Weight: 700 or 900. Tracking: -0.02em.
usage_rules.body: Use 'IBM Plex Sans' for all UI text, labels, and paragraphs. Weight: 400 or 500.
usage_rules.data: Use 'JetBrains Mono' for ALL numeric data, IDs (Job Order #, SKU), and status codes. This ensures tabular alignment.

typography.installation: Import fonts via Google Fonts in index.css: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Chivo:wght@400;700;900&family=IBM+Plex+Sans:wght@400;500;600&family=JetBrains+Mono:wght@400;500&display=swap');

buttons.primary: rounded-sm bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 font-medium shadow-[0_0_10px_rgba(14,165,233,0.3)]

inputs.style: rounded-sm border-border bg-background/50 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary focus:border-primary

tables.header: border-b border-border bg-muted/50 text-xs uppercase tracking-wider font-medium text-muted-foreground

badges.style: rounded-full px-2 py-0.5 text-xs font-semibold uppercase tracking-wide

visual_enhancers.borders: Use 1px borders with low opacity (border-white/10) to define structure without clutter.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Avoid large drop shadows. Use 'glow' effects for active states (box-shadow: 0 0 15px rgba(var(--primary), 0.1)).
visual_enhancers.micro_interactions: All interactive elements must have a hover state that changes brightness or border color.

icons.style: Stroke width 1.5px for a technical look.

login_background.usage: Full screen background for Login/Auth pages with overlay bg-black/80

instructions_to_main_agent.file_structure: Use .js extension for all React components (not .tsx).
instructions_to_main_agent.theme_implementation: Ensure 'dark' class is applied to the root HTML element by default. Do not rely on system preference alone.
instructions_to_main_agent.component_customization: When using Shadcn components, override the default 'rounded-md' with 'rounded-sm' or 'rounded-none' to match the industrial aesthetic.
instructions_to_main_agent.data_display: For the 'Dashboard' and 'Production' modules, prioritize dense data grids. Avoid excessive padding in tables. Use 'h-8' or 'h-9' for table rows instead of default.
instructions_to_main_agent.charts: Use Recharts. Style them with the defined semantic colors. Ensure tooltips are dark mode compatible.
instructions_to_main_agent.navigation: Implement a sidebar navigation that is collapsible. It should persist across all modules.
instructions_to_main_agent.testing: Add 'data-testid' to all buttons, inputs, and major containers.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.

Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.

Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed.

Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
